definition: to know by heart (so well that you can recite it backwards)
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
variant of 背[bei1]
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
as/as if/such as
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: He can run off many classics from memory.
sentences.chinese: 他能把许多古典作品倒背如流。

sentences.english: The child could reel off many poems of the Tang Dynasty at the age of five.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子五岁时就能把许多唐诗倒背如流。

sentences.english: He can fluently study The Bible from Z to A.
sentences.chinese: 他能倒背如流地背诵整部《圣经》。

sentences.english: You've read that book so many times you must know it backwards by now!
sentences.chinese: 那本书你读了很多遍，现在一定能倒背如流了。

sentences.english: All the actors know the play backward.
sentences.chinese: 所有演员对剧本都熟知到可以倒背如流。
我对这本书是倒背如流。

sentences.english: He also has nearly 200 phone number recite, I could not fail to notice.
sentences.chinese: 至今他还能将近二百个电话号码倒背如流，一号不差。

sentences.english: She must know the play backwards by now.
sentences.chinese: 她现在对这个剧本肯定是倒背如流。
我对这本书是倒背如流。

definition: lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
to recite/to repeat from memory
to learn by heart/to memorize
word for word/verbatim
can't remember
see 一字不漏[yi1 zi4 bu4 lou4]
(slang) swearword/four-letter word
Three Character Classic, 13th century reading primer consisting of Confucian tenets in lines of 3 characters
to read intensively
Three Hundred Tang Poems, an anthology collected around 1763 by Sun Zhu 孫誅
to have a highly retentive memory/to have sth imprinted in one's memory
(idiom) (of one's speech) eloquent/articulate
without missing a word
to learn by heart/to commit to memory/to remember/to memorize in silence
literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
to copy/to transcribe
